SENT.plain: Accompanying neurological symptoms and signs are diagnostic hallmarks of fourth nerve palsy (4NP) from an intra-axial lesion
Due to the proximity of the trochlear nucleus and fascicles to the inferior colliculus (IC), auditory symptoms including tinnitus may occur with an intra-axial 4NP
A 53-year-old man with hypertension and diabetes developed right 4NP with a sudden worsening of tinnitus
MRI disclosed an infarction involving the trochlear fascicle and IC in the left dorsal midbrain
Tinnitus may be a symptom indicating an intra-axial lesion causing a 4NP
